name: Strawberry Summer
author: Melissa Brayden
note: Really nice romantic story. I actually only realized part-way that this was my second time reading it, but it was a nice novel to re-read anyway.

name: The Weakest Tamer Began a Journey to Pick Up Trash Vol. 1
author: Honobonoru500
note: A cute healing story about a little girl who runs away from her abusive village and disovers the rest of the world. Not an isekai, for the most part.

name: Kuma Kuma Bear S2
note: Another pretty good season of one of my favorite light novel series. They didn't quite get the awesomeness of the fight scene in the final episode, though.

name: Skip to Loafer
note: A fun slice of life anime with a really fun protagonist. All in all, a really enjoyable heartwarming story.

name: The Weakest Tamer Began a Journey to Pick Up Trash Vol. 2
author: Honobonoru500
note: Another really cute story. It leans more on the isekai bit than the previous novel, and Ivy becomes a bona-fide Sherlock Holmes.

name: The Weakest Tamer Began a Journey to Pick Up Trash Vol. 3
author: Honobonoru500
note: Another good volume. This is the first isekai novel (I know of) to give the past memories a small downside; what if a bunch of stuff was actually different from Earth? My favorite joke is 'eggs' actually being a kind of fruit.

name: Klonoa: Empire of Dreams
author: Namco
note: Main game finished. Like the original game, a nice casual platformer. I might enjoy this game more than the original Klonoa because it focuses more on puzzles.

name: Surviving in Another World as a Villainess Fox Girl! Vol. 1
author: Riia Ai
note: Mixed feelings about this one. One the one hand, the novel has a pretty interesting concept; multiple reincarnated people is not completely original, but it's still pretty rare. On the other hand, nothing actually really happens in the novel. My prediction for the next volume is that Laura turns out to be reincarnated too.

name: The Reincarnated Villainess Won't Seek Revenge Volume 1
author: Akako
note: Mixed feelings about this one too. The plot is pretty interesting and the main story is actually really good, but the romance subplot feels creepy. Not sure if I'm reading the next volume.

name: Pikmin 4
author: Nintendo
note: Absolutely fantastic game. This is everything I like in a video game, and I'm definitely going to be trying the earlier games in the series.

name: Reborn to Master the Blade Volume 3
author: Hayaken
note: Still a pretty interesting novel. It's the last part that was adapted for the anime so I already knew what was going to happen, but the light novel goes more into the motivations of the characters.

name: Pikmin 3 Deluxe
author: Nintendo
note: Really great game, although not quite as good as Pikmin 4.

name: Reborn to Master the Blade Volume 4
author: Hayaken
note: This is the first post-anime novel and still a pretty interesting series. The first two-thirds of the book is about a play so it's really surprising when the plot suddenly takes off at the end.

name: Persona 5 Royal
author: Atlus
note: The original game was already the pinnacle of classic turn-based RPG's, and Royal adds even more cool features on top of that. The only gripes I have with the game is that I'm not too fond of Mementos and I don't like the Velvet Room alarm system.

name: Kuma Kuma Kuma Bear Volume 14
author: Kumanano
note: This volume was a lot lighter on story; a swimsuit episode, in fact. We do get to see exactly how weak Yuna is without her onesie.

name: The Weakest Tamer Began a Journey to Pick Up Trash Vol. 4
author: Honobonoru500
note: It's a pretty good novel, although less eventful than the previous novels. I also feel like the story slows down a lot when they leave the village. Still a lot of cute moments, though.

name: Taking My Reincarnation One Step at a Time Vol. 1
author: Kaya
note: Amazing first volume. The characters are interesting, the plot is nice, there are a bunch of funny moments, and everything is well-written. I can't wait to read more of this series.

name: Kuma Kuma Kuma Bear Volume 15
author: Kumanano
note: This volume is back to having some pretty cool fight scenes and generally more of the stuff I like about this series. This was the end of an arc, though, so I'm curious what happens next.

name: Back to the Battlefield Volume 1
author: Kiraku Kishima
note: Pretty cool story. It's fun to have heroes come back from retirement and see how their age hasn't slowed them down. You also don't see many light novels with 'older' characters.

name: Taking My Reincarnation One Step at a Time Vol. 2
author: Kaya
note: Another amazing volume. Even the unlikable character gets likable in this volume, and a new villain is introduced. The main plot point introduced in the first novel is already taken care of so I wonder what the next volume is going to be about.

name: Klonoa 2: Lunatea's Veil
author: Namco
note: What a fun chill platformer. Those final few stages were brutal though, so I didn't get all of the collectibles. The story is also wonderful and wholesome.

name: Secrets of the Silent Witch Vol. 4
author: Matsuri Isora
note: Another very good volume with a lot of good character moments. It also feels like the story is building to some kind of climax.

name: The Retired Demon of the Maxed-Out Village Vol. 1
author: Akinosuke Nishiyama
note: Pretty cool novel. The actual plot gets going pretty quickly, which is actually a nice change. There's also some interesting setup for later volumes.

name: Reincarnated as a Sword Vol. 11
author: Yuu Tanaka
note: Another amazing volume. There are less cute moments and instead we get a crazy ride with the plot heating up, and things getting really serious.

name: Kirby: Squeak Squad
author: Nintendo
note: Not my favorite Kirby game, since Forgotten Land and Amazing Mirror exist, but still a lot of fun to play. I feel like this one is a bit less creative than the other Kirby games though.

name: Reincarnated as a Sword Vol. 12
author: Yuu Tanaka
note: A fantastic follow-up to the last novel. Some old characters return and some even older characters are expanded upon. The story also seems to be building up to some kind of climax. Will we learn the truth about Teacher next volume?

name: The Dirty Way to Destroy the Goddess's Heroes, Vol. 5
author: Sakuma Sasaki
note: This is an interesting one. While the novel does have an exciting climax, most of the novel is an extended lore dump.

name: Super Mario Bros. Wonder
author: Nintendo
note: Super Mario Wonder is a really fun game. In terms of game design, it's interesting to see a game where every level has its own gimmick that basically isn't reused anywhere else in the game.

name: Castlevania: Dawn of Sorrow
author: Konami
note: Dawn of Sorrow is another fantastic IGA game. I like it better than Aria, but I still think Portrait of Ruin is the best Castlevania I've played so far.

name: The Dirty Way to Destroy the Goddess's Heroes, Vol. 6
author: Sakuma Sasaki
note: Like the previous volume, this one has a lot of lore. Other than that, there are some scenes of the heroines acting all jealous. The ending might surprise you: of course it ends with a harem instead of the protagonist picking someone. Kind of a low note to end on.

name: I Surrendered My Sword for a New Life as a Mage Vol. 1
author: Shin Kouduki
note: This one is a mixed bag. On the one hand, the story is somewhat interesting with good world-building and it's one of the first isekai novels where the origin world is not Earth. On the other hand, I think the protagonist is pretty boring.

name: Peddler in Another World Volume 3
author: Hiiro Shimotsuki
note: TThis was an all-around fun volume. There were some fun moments where the protagonist one-ups the villain. There were some nice heartwarming scenes with Aina and her mother. And a lot of fun scenes with the introduction of Shiro's grandma. The volume also ends with a fun cliffhanger.

name: Ys IX: Monstrum Nox
author: Falcom
note: Really cool game with a bunch of interesting mechanics and very satisfying combat. I liked all of the characters and the story is cool with a nice ending. Even though this is only my third Ys game, I still consider myself a fan of the series.
